clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Incidental Findings Information on Lung Cancer Screening Intent
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Incidental Findings Information on Lung Cancer Screening Intent: A Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: UNC Cecil G. Sheps Center for Health Services Research

brief_summary.textblock:
This online randomized controlled trial seeks to determine if inclusion of incidental findings information in a lung cancer screening decision aid affects screening intent among screening-eligible individuals. Participants will view either a decision aid with incidental findings information or without and indicate their intent to pursue lung cancer screening.
Hypothesis: Inclusion of incidental findings in a decision aid will decrease intent to screen among participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of individuals who plan to pursue lung cancer screening
primary_outcome.description: This will be assessed by a survey item where participants indicate their response to a statement of whether they plan to pursue lung cancer screening, with answer choices being strongly agree, agree, disagree and strongly disagree. Comparison between the intervention and control groups will be made.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean score on scale of lung cancer screening knowledge
secondary_outcome.description: Lung cancer screening knowledge tested by 6 multiple choice questions on facts of the benefit and harms of screening. The questions will be answered before and after participants watch a lung cancer screening decision aid. Scores will be determined by the number of correct answers for questions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean rating of benefit and harms of screening
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate (Likert 1-5 scale with 1 being less important and 5 being more important) 6 lung cancer screening benefits and harms on importance to them.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time Lung Cancer Screening Benefit and Harms are ranked first and last
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rank six lung cancer screening benefits and harms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean ranking of benefit and harms of screening
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rank six lung cancer screening benefits and harms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of time each lung cancer screening harm is ranked highest of the five potential harms
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rank six lung cancer screening benefits and harms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean ranking of incidental findings attribute
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rank six lung cancer screening benefits and harms, including one on incidental findings. Comparison of mean ranking will be made between the intervention and control groups.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Decision aid with incidental findings information
arm_group.description: Participants in this arm will view a video decision aid that include information on incidental findings in lung cancer screening.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Decision aid without incidental findings information
arm_group.description: Participants in this arm will view a video decision aid that does not include information on incidental findings in lung cancer screening.

intervention.intervention_name: Lung Cancer Screening Decision Aid with Incidental Findings Information
intervention.description: The intervention consists of a previously tested and developed brief lung cancer screening video decision aid with the addition of information on incidental findings for lung cancer screening.
intervention.arm_group_label: Decision aid with incidental findings information

intervention.intervention_name: Lung Cancer Screening Decision Aid without Incidental Findings Information
intervention.description: The intervention consists of a previously tested and developed brief lung cancer screening video decision aid that does not include information on incidental findings.
intervention.arm_group_label: Decision aid without incidental findings information

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 55-80 year old male or female
- Current or former smoker who quit within the last 15 years
- At least 30 pack years of smoking
Exclusion Criteria:
- N/A
